name: bell pepper production, open field | bell pepper | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/19524/documentation

This dataset represents the production of 1 kg of fresh Capsicum during September, 2015-May, 2016 at a farm located in village Bhagatpur Ratan, District Moradabad of Uttar Pradesh State in India. In this area, fields are irrigated with ground water using electric pump for surface irrigation. The farm has a yield of 3000 kg fresh matter per ha for this crop cycle. Sowing date for the crop is 12-October, 2015 and harvesting date is 14-Feburary, 2016. Mineral NP fertilizer input is 245.63-69 kg/ha. Organic fertilizer applied amounts to 60,000 kg of manure from cattle dung. Insecticide used has active ingredient as Carbofuran 450g/ha, Chlorantranilipore 60g/ha (Clothianidin used as proxy), Thiomethoxam 75g/ha, Monocrotophos 540g/ha (Dichlorvos (DDVP) used as proxy). Machinery is used only for soil cultivation with fuel consumption of 12.48 kg/ha using plough and rotary cultivator for soil tillage.   ;[This dataset is meant to replace the following datasets:]

This activity starts about twelve weeks after the harvest of the previous crop. The soil is prepared for cultivation in First week of September and sowing of seeds started about five weeks after soil preparation. Thereafter the crop is mature for harvesting in about 4 months.

The activity ends with the harvesting of the mature Capsicum from the Capsicum plant
category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/01:Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities/012:Growing of perennial crops/0128:Growing of spices, aromatic, drug and pharmaceutical crops

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Soil cultivating date for the main crop: 07-September, 2015; Harvesting date main crop: 14-Feburary, 2016. The soil cultivation, sowing and harvesting dates are taken as the middle date of the week or fortnight told to the data collector by the farmer. Total time from date of sowing to date of harvesting comes to 125 days.  The data is collected for one crop cycle. The cycle of one year is considered for entry in ecoeditor.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Village Bhagatpur Ratan, District Moradabad of Uttar Pradesh State in India
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Cultivation of Capsicum follows conventional production standards
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: Ecoinvent LCI calculation tool for crop production was used to calculate field emissions from the cultivation process. Number of wet days have been taken for neighboring region (New Delhi) and rainfall data is Normal rainfall for Western Uttar Pradesh where the farm is located.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: The farmer was identified and contacted by agriculture science faculty familiar with the local farmers in the region. Data was collected directly from the farmer through semi-structured interview using a questionnaire based on the input requirements of the ecoinvent LCI calculation tool for crop production. The farmer does not maintain any written records and has provided the data from recent memory. In this region, typically farmers are unable to provide exact name of active ingredient in the pesticide they use and the same was noted from details given on the pesticide packet. Individual farmer is not able to calculate fuel consumption for his own farm alone and this information has been collected from farming community of the area

exchanges.description: Total amount of active substance/s of fertilisers needed for the production of 'bell pepper' is calculated to be circa 1.17E-01 kg. Fertiliser/s used in this dataset is/are: 'lime', 'nitrogen fertiliser, as N', 'phosphate fertiliser, as P2O5', 'urea, as N'. The total amount of active substance/s is doubled in order to account for the packaging of the dilluted product of fertiliser/s that is/are applied. Therefore, 2.33E-01 kg of packaging for fertilisers is justified with this exchange.

Pesticide/s used in this dataset is/are: '[thio]carbamate-compound', 'cyclic N-compound', 'organophosphorus-compound, unspecified'. Therefore, 7.50E-04 kg of packaging for pesticides is justified with this exchange.
